Description: EPA and the Department of Justice announced a consent decree with Arizona Public Service Company, Southern California Edison, El Paso Electric Company, Public Service Company of New Mexico, Salt River Project Agricultural Improvement and Power District, and Tucson Electric Power Company. (The consent decree does not specificy how the $1.5 million civil penalty is to be divided among the defendants. Here we assume it is equally divided as $300,00 to each of the five corporate defendants. That amount is added to the costs --which are specified--of the projects the companies are required to fund.)

The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission approved a consent agreement between FERC's Office of Enforcement and the North American Electric Reliability Corporation and Arizona Public Service Company that included a $3.25 million civil penalty to be paid by the company in connection with its involvement in the Sept. 8, 2011 Southwest blackout.

On April 8, 2005, a Notice of Violation and Proposed Imposition of a Civil Penalty in the amount of $50,000 was issued for a Severity Level III violation involving the licensee's failure to perform a written safety evaluation and obtain Commission approval prior to making a procedural change which resulted in a change to the facility as described in the Updated Final Safety Analysis Report that increased the probability of a malfunction of equipment important to safety previously evaluated in the safety analysis report.

Description: The Arizona Attorney General secured an agreement with Arizona Public Service Company providing $24 million for approximately 225,000 APS consumers who were not on their most economical rate plan for electric utility service.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of the EPA's Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) ICIS FE&C file downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at http://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads#downloads
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).
